titleStmt.title: The First Part of King Henry the Fourth
titleStmt.author: William Shakespeare

respStmt.name: Craig A. Berry, Martin Mueller, and Clifford Wulfman
Lawrence Berland, Hilary Bina, Katherine Gould, Kreg Segal, Nicholas Terrell

publicationStmt.p: The WordHoard Shakespeare is a joint project of the Perseus Project at Tufts University, The Northwestern University Library, and Northwestern University Academic Technologies. It is derived from The Globe Shakespeare , the one-volume version of the Cambridge Shakespeare , edited by W. G. Clark, J. Glover, and W. A. Wright (1891-3). The Internet Shakespeare editions of the quartos and folios have been consulted to create a modern text that observes as closely as possible the morphological and prosodic practices of the earliest editions. Spellings, especially of contracted and hyphenated forms, have been standardized across the corpus. The text has been fully lemmatized and morphosyntactically tagged.

Â© 2003. The copyright to The WordHoard Shakespeare is owned jointly by Northwestern University and Tufts University. The WordHoard Shakespeare is provided for free solely for non-commercial use by students, scholars, and the public. Any commercial use or publication of it, in whole or in part, without prior written authorization of the copyright holders is strictly prohibited.

sourceDesc.p: The Wordhoard Shakespeare is derived from, but not identical with, The Globe Shakespeare , the one-volume version of the Cambridge Shakespeare (1891-3) edited by W. G. Clark, J. Glover, and W. A. Wright.

castItem.roleDesc: Henry Percy, son of the Earl of Northumberland
a friend to the Archbishop of York
wife of Hotspur and sister to Mortimer
daughter to Glendower and wife to Mortimer
hostess of a tavern in Eastcheap
Lords, Officers, Drawers, Travellers and Attendants

div.head: Act 1, Scene 1
div.stage: Enter KING HENRY, LORD JOHN OF LANCASTER, the EARL OF WESTMORELAND, SIR WALTER BLUNT, and others.

div.head: Act 1, Scene 2
div.stage: London. An apartment of the Prince's.
Enter the PRINCE OF WALES and FALSTAFF.

div.head: Act 1, Scene 3
div.stage: Enter the KING, NORTHUMBERLAND, WORCESTER, HOTSPUR, SIR WALTER BLUNT, with others.

l.stage: Exeunt King Henry, Blunt, and train.

div.head: Act 2, Scene 1
div.stage: Enter a Carrier with a lantern in his hand.

sp.speaker: Falstaff
sp.stage: Enter GADSHILL, BARDOLPH and PETO with him.

sp.speaker: Falstaff
sp.stage: Here they rob them and bind them.

sp.speaker: Poins
sp.stage: As they are sharing, the Prince and Poins set upon them; they all run away; and Falstaff, after a blow or two, runs away too, leaving the booty behind them.

div.head: Act 2, Scene 3
div.stage: Enter HOTSPUR, solus, reading a letter.

sp.speaker: Prince
sp.stage: Here they both call him; the drawer stands amazed, not knowing which way to go.

sp.speaker: Prince
sp.stage: Enter FALSTAFF, GADSHILL, BARDOLPH, and PETO; FRANCIS following with wine.

sp.speaker: Prince
sp.stage: Exeunt all except the Prince and Peto.

sp.speaker: Prince
sp.stage: He searcheth his pocketsand findeth certain papers.

div.head: Act 3, Scene 1
div.stage: Enter HOTSPUR, WORCESTER, MORTIMER, and GLENDOWER.

l.stage: Glendower speaks to her in Welsh, and she answers him in the same.
The lady speaks again in Welsh.
The lady speaks again in Welsh.

sp.speaker: Hotspur
sp.stage: Here the lady sings a Welsh song.

div.head: Act 3, Scene 2
div.stage: Enter the KING, PRINCE OF WALES, and others.

sp.speaker: Falstaff
sp.stage: Enter the PRINCE and PETO, marching, and FALSTAFF meets them playing on his truncheon cheon like a fife.

div.head: Act 4, Scene 3
div.stage: Enter HOTSPUR, WORCESTER, DOUGLAS, and VERNON.

div.head: Act 4, Scene 4
div.stage: Enter the ARCHBISHOP OF YORK and SIR MICHAEL.

div.head: Act 5, Scene 1
div.stage: Enter the KING, PRINCE OF WALES, LORD JOHN OF LANCASTER, EARL OF WESTMORELAND, SIR WALTER BLUNT, and FALSTAFF.

l.stage: Exeunt all but the Prince of Wales and Falstaff.
The trumpets sound. They embrace, and exeunt.

div.head: Act 5, Scene 3
div.stage: The KING enters with his power. Alarum to the battle. Then enter DOUGLAS and SIR WALTER BLUNT.

sp.speaker: Falstaff
sp.stage: The Prince draws it out, and finds it to be a bottle of sack.

sp.speaker: Prince
sp.stage: He throws the bottle at him.

div.head: Act 5, Scene 4
div.stage: Enter the KING, the PRINCE, LORD JOHN OF LANCASTER, and EARL OF WESTMORELAND.

l.stage: They fight; the King being in danger, re-enter Prince of Wales.

sp.speaker: Falstaff
sp.stage: Re-enter DOUGLAS; he fights with FALSTAFF, who falls down as if he were dead, and exit DOUGLAS. HOTSPUR is wounded, and falls.

l.stage: He spieth Falstaff on the ground.

sp.speaker: Falstaff
sp.stage: Takes up Hotspur on his back.
Re-enter the PRINCE OF WALES and LORD JOHN OF LANCASTER.

l.stage: Exeunt Prince of Wales and Lancaster.

div.head: Act 5, Scene 5
div.stage: Enter the KING, PRINCE OF WALES, LORD JOHN OF LANCASTER, EARL OF WESTMORELAND, with WORCESTER and VERNON prisoners.
